content.label: Introduction
content.value:
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's the standard markup language for creating the structure and content of web pages, Think of it as the skeleton or blueprint for a webpage. It uses special tags, like

for paragraphs and

for headings, to tell the browser how to display the text, images, and other elements on the page.

content.label: What are 'tags' on HTML?
content.value: These tags act like instructions, telling the browser things like this is a heading, this is a paragraph, or this is an image. By combining these tags and their attributes, you can structure and present information in a meaningful way.

content.label: Please check the next video for more information about HTML!
Conclusion
content.value: HTML is relatively easy to learn, and even a basic understanding can help you appreciate how web pages are built and how they work.

contents.label: Introduction to JavaScript
contents.value: JavaScript (JS) is a high-level, interpreted programming language used to create dynamic and interactive web pages. It is one of the core technologies of web development alongside HTML and CSS.
